Description: Fragment of floor with turn to rim of black-figured North Ionian pottery plate; slipped white; on floor, metopal frieze of ‘triglyphs’ (three vertical lines mostly in thin glaze) and ‘metopes’ (black squares; open square with messy dots); two dilute lines surround tondo: hindquarters (incised circles on rump) and tail of feline to left; underside: flat moulding; brown bands and line.
Curator's comments: This sherd may belong with GR 1965.9-30.496. Compare with R M Cook, East Greek Pottery (1998), 96, fig. 12.1 (a): "precursor of Clazomenian black-figure".
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GG.807)
